title: Fix admin login by updating backend admin password to JATINSHARMA2580

requirements.text: Update the backend admin password so that the Admin Login accepts the exact password `JATINSHARMA2580` and no longer rejects it as invalid.
acceptanceCriteria: Calling `adminLogin("JATINSHARMA2580")` returns a non-null session token.
Attempting to log in via the Admin Login UI using password `JATINSHARMA2580` successfully authenticates and opens the admin dashboard.
Attempting to log in with any other password fails with an 'Invalid admin password' error message in the UI.

requirements.text: Ensure the admin password change persists correctly across upgrades for already-deployed canisters (i.e., upgrading the canister must not keep/reset the admin password to the old value).

quotes: Is problem ko theek kar do only is problem ko

acceptanceCriteria: After an upgrade deployment, the Admin Login still accepts `JATINSHARMA2580`.
No migration/upgrade logic resets the admin password to a different value than `JATINSHARMA2580`.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutable paths.
nonGoals: Do not add new authentication methods (e.g., Internet Identity, third-party auth).
Do not redesign the admin UI beyond what is required to confirm the password fix.
Do not change client login/OTP flows.
